NomaiObject: Excavation Site 1 CASSAVA: I am immensely relieved to report the relative well-being of the native species of Timber Hearth. They too, must have been protected from deadly matter by the water they dwell in. 2 1 CASSAVA: Disappointingly, as I have observed on Giant's Deep, water appears to only temporarily displace the matter where it has come to rest, and has no lasting effect on the matter. 3 1 CASSAVA: Although it may not offer a lasting solution to the matter, on the sunward side, this discovery provides an answer to the greatest question that has been weighing on my mind. 4 3 CASSAVA: If the deadly matter is unable to penetrate water - unable to harm those underwater - I must infer it was why I alone was spared what happened to our clan, aboard the Deep Storm Station. 5 4 CASSAVA: This hypothesis would also explain how several native species of the star system (that were within reach of the deadly matter's reach) dwelling underwater have miracurously survived. 6 5 CASSAVA: A terrifying realization has just struck me. Oh, goodness. I owe great gratitude to that planet's thick atmosphere for obscuring it completely from my sight - or I could have invited them to a similar fate... 7 6 CASSAVA: Of note to self: I must be careful to NEVER lock the Quantum Moon in orbit around that planet for any extended period to keep those species safe from grave danger.
